item.title: US tells Ukraine it must leave Donetsk for peace deal, source says
item.description: US negotiators have told Ukraine during peace talks in Berlin that it must agree to withdraw its forces from the eastern Donetsk region as part of any deal to end the nearly four-year-old war, an official familiar with the matter said. The source, speaking on condition of anonymity as Ukrainian an

item.title: Four major trade orgs to seek review of three amended provisos
item.description:
Four major trade bodies in Bangladesh's industrial realm seek a rethink on three key amended sections of the labour law as they believe such new provisos could adversely affect employment and hike the cost of doing business.
As planned, the organisations will initially request the reigning i

item.title: CA pays homage to Liberation War martyrs on Victory Day
item.description: Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus on Tuesday paid rich tributes to the martyrs of the Liberation War by placing a wreath at the National Memorial here on the outskirts of the capital marking the 55th Victory Day. He laid the wreath at the altar of the National Memorial around 6:56 am. After

item.title: Jubo League leader hacked to death in Dakshinkhan
item.description: A Jubo League leader has been hacked to death in a public gathering in Dhaka’s Dakshinkhan, according to police. The dead has been identified as Shahjahan Sheikh, 46. Police say the murder occurred at Taltola intersection at 8:45pm. He was involved in several businesses. He was also the pr

item.title: President pays tributes to Liberation War heroes on Victory Day
item.description: President Mohammed Shahabuddin on Tuesday paid rich tributes to the martyrs of the 1971 Liberation War by placing a wreath at the National Memorial here, on the outskirts of the capital, marking the 55th Victory Day. The Head of the State laid the wreath at the altar of the National Memorial with

item.title: Nation celebrates V-Day today amid new ambiance
item.description: As the 16th December dawns today, the nation begins to celebrate the Victory Day marking Bangladesh’s liberation from the then Pakistani occupation this day 54 years ago through a nine-month bloodstained war. On December 16 in 1971, as history says, Bangladesh was born as an independent coun

item.title: Hadi flown to Singapore by air ambulance
item.description: An air ambulance carrying fatally-wounded Inqilab Mancha spokesperson Sharif Osman Hadi left for Singapore on Monday. At 1:40pm, he was transferred to the air ambulance, which departed 10 minutes later. Hadi will receive advanced treatment in Singapore. Earlier, at 1:10pm, an ambulance carrying

item.title: LGD proposes Tk 9.79b project for 18 DSCC wards
item.description: The Local Government Division (LGD) under the Ministry of Local Government, Rural Development and Co-operatives has submitted a Tk 9.79-billion-project proposal to upgrade 123.53 kilometres of local roads in 18 wards that were incorporated into Dhaka South City Corporation (DSCC) in 2016, sources a

item.title: Past projects taking toll on state coffer
item.description: State bank borrowing is swelling for having to fund the development projects undertaken by the fallen regime, as the interim government is in a double bind because ditching those will amount to twofold losses. Finance Adviser of the post-uprising government Dr Salehuddin Ahmed Monday struck such d

item.title: Health ministry’s poor show drags execution
item.description: Despite being the third-largest budget-holder, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has recorded the lowest project- implementation rate, affecting overall development progress and potentially slowing Bangladesh’s economic growth, officials said on Monday. The slow performance has also

item.title: Renata’s debt-reduction strategy may spur new entrants to secondary market
item.description: Renata’s listed preference shares, offering a 15 per cent return, may serve as an example for other companies seeking to reduce debt burdens while strengthening investor confidence. To replace high-cost short-term loans with lower-cost, long-term funding, the drug manufacturer issued prefere

item.title: Bondi gunmen were inspired by Islamic State, had travelled to the Philippines, Australia police say
item.description: Two alleged gunmen who attacked a Hanukkah event at Sydney’s Bondi Beach had travelled to the Philippines before the assault which killed 15 people and appeared to be inspired by Islamic State, police said on Tuesday. The attack on Sunday was Australia’s worst mass shooting in nearly 3
